  <!-- Performance API Polyfills -->
  <script>
  (function () {
    var noop = function noop() {};
    if ("performance" in window === false) {
      window.performance = {};
    }
    window.performance.mark = performance.mark || noop;
    window.performance.measure = performance.measure || noop;
    if ("now" in window.performance === false) {
      var nowOffset = Date.now();
      if (performance.timing && performance.timing.navigationStart) {
        nowOffset = performance.timing.navigationStart;
      }
      window.performance.now = function now() {
        return Date.now() - nowOffset;
      };
    }
  })();
  </script>

    (function () {
      var now = Date.now()

<script type="text/javascript">
    var bodyCacheable = true;
    
    var exclusionReason = {"shouldRender":true,"forced":false};
    var ssrInfo = {"cacheExclusionReason":"","renderBodyTime":832,"renderTimeStamp":1747102044026}

    <!--pageHtmlEmbeds.bodyStart start-->
    <script type="wix/htmlEmbeds" id="pageHtmlEmbeds.bodyStart start"></script>

<script id="wix-first-paint">
    if (window.ResizeObserver &&
        (!window.PerformanceObserver || !PerformanceObserver.supportedEntryTypes || PerformanceObserver.supportedEntryTypes.indexOf('paint') === -1)) {
        new ResizeObserver(function (entries, observer) {
            entries.some(function (entry) {
                var contentRect = entry.contentRect;
                if (contentRect.width > 0 && contentRect.height > 0) {
                    requestAnimationFrame(function (now) {
                        window.wixFirstPaint = now;
                        dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('wixFirstPaint'));
                    });
                    observer.disconnect();
                    return true;
                }
            });
        }).observe(document.body);
    }
</script>

ine-height);--ricos-custom-h5-font-size:var(--textH5Font-size);--ricos-custom-h5-font-family:var(--textH5Font-family);--ricos-custom-h5-text-decoration:var(--textH5Font-text-decoration);--ricos-custom-h5-color:rgb(var(--textH5Color));--ricos-custom-h6-font-weight:var(--textH6Font-weight);--ricos-custom-h6-font-style:var(--textH6Font-style);--ricos-custom-h6-line-height:var(--textH6Font-line-height);--ricos-custom-h6-font-size:var(--textH6Font-size);--ricos-custom-h6-font-family:var(--textH6Font-family);--ricos-custom-h6-text-decoration:var(--textH6Font-text-decoration);--ricos-custom-h6-color:rgb(var(--textH6Color));--ricos-custom-quote-line-height:var(--textQuoteFont-line-height);--ricos-custom-quote-font-size:var(--textQuoteFont-size);--ricos-custom-quote-font-style:var(--textQuoteFont-style);--ricos-custom-quote-font-family:var(--textQuoteFont-family);--ricos-custom-quote-font-weight:var(--textQuoteFont-weight);--ricos-custom-quote-text-decoration:var(--textQuoteFont-text-decoration);--ricos-custom-quote-color:rgb(var(--textQuoteColor));--ricos-custom-quote-border-color:rgb(var(--textLinksAndHashtagsColor));--ricos-custom-quote-margin-inline-start:var(--ricosQuoteMarginInlineStart);--ricos-custom-code-block-line-height:1.5;--ricos-custom-link-font-style:inherit;--ricos-custom-link-font-weight:inherit;--ricos-custom-link-text-decoration:inherit;--ricos-custom-link-color:rgb(var(--textLinksAndHashtagsColor));--ricos-custom-hashtag-font-style:inherit;--ricos-custom-hashtag-font-weight:inherit;--ricos-custom-hashtag-text-decoration:inherit;--ricos-custom-hashtag-color:rgb(var(--textLinksAndHashtagsColor));--ricos-custom-footer-toolbar-padding-inline-start:var(--ricosFooterPadding);--ricos-custom-footer-toolbar-padding-inline-end:var(--ricosFooterPadding);--ricos-custom-editor-add-plugin-button-position-inline-start:var(--ricosAddPluginButtonStart);--ricos-breakout-normal-padding-start:var(--ricosNormalPadding);--ricos-breakout-normal-padding-end:var(--ricosNormalPadding);--ricos-breakout-full-width-padding-start:var(--ricosFullWidthPadding);--ricos-breakout-full-width-padding-end:var(--ricosFullWidthPadding)" data-id="content-viewer"><div class="LZNQc"><div type="first" data-hook="rcv-block-first"></div><div class="oLw7q"><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-foo"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>The initial fuss around Microsoft “forcing” customers into LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing (January 2020, March 2020, second half of 2020, TBD) appears to have overshadowed the crucial questions organizations should be addressing: The What, How, Where, &amp; Why associated with secure LDAP communication. After speaking with security professionals attempting to implement these very settings and based on the results of Trimarc’s </span><a target="_blank" href="https://www.trimarcsecurity.com/ad-security-assessment" rel="noopener" class="XSxHY gMMfB" data-hook="web-link"><span>Active Directory Security Assessments</span></a><span> it has become clear that the right answers are proving difficult to come by (we have seen next to zero adoption of these highly recommended configurations). </span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block1"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1" dir="auto" id="viewer-ak3jb"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block2"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="iED3l T-jvd PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:2" dir="auto" id="viewer-5uj6r"><span class="E07CK"><span>What Is LDAP Channel Binding and LDAP Signing?</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block3"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-6g2jq"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>It is important to recognize that while these two settings are often mentioned in the same breath, they are two distinct configurations and should be treated as such. But before breaking these down further, it would be beneficial to give a brief overview of LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol). LDAP at its core is a communication protocol commonly used by directory services like Active Directory to talk back and forth with applications regarding identity and access. The easiest way to think about this is with authentication. Active Directory stores user credentials needed by programs when validating identity. In order for a program to retrieve said credentials it can reach out to Active Directory over LDAP and Active Directory will respond in kind over the same protocol. </span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block4"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="KaA6n" id="viewer-edojj"><div class="XzRcS _0fdLB"><figure class="omglR" data-hook="figure-IMAGE"><div data-hook="image-viewer" class="IySXE"><div style="--dim-height:280;--dim-width:883;--ricos-image-default-border-color:unset" id="edojj" class="ZYT8Y ckerf _-2uSA" data-hook="image-viewer-edojj"><wow-image id="bf9d03_349861fbe91746fa8c07a8e905b81152~mv2.png" class="undefined Waddv" data-image-info="{&quot;containerId&quot;:&quot;edojj&quot;,&quot;displayMode&quot;:&quot;fill&quot;,&quot;isLQIP&quot;:true,&quot;isSEOBot&quot;:false,&quot;lqipTransition&quot;:&quot;blur&quot;,&quot;encoding&quot;:&quot;AVIF&quot;,&quot;imageData&quot;:{&quot;width&quot;:883,&quot;height&quot;:280,&quot;uri&quot;:&quot;bf9d03_349861fbe91746fa8c07a8e905b81152~mv2.png&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;displayMode&quot;:&quot;fill&quot;}}" data-motion-part="BG_IMG" data-bg-effect-name="" data-has-ssr-src="true" data-animate-blur=""><img src="https://static.wixstatic.com/media/bf9d03_349861fbe91746fa8c07a8e905b81152~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_88,h_28,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/bf9d03_349861fbe91746fa8c07a8e905b81152~mv2.png" style="width:100%;height:100%;object-fit:cover;object-position:50% 50%;max-width:100%" data-pin-url="https://www.hub.trimarcsecurity.com/post/ldap-channel-binding-and-signing" data-pin-media="https://static.wixstatic.com/media/bf9d03_349861fbe91746fa8c07a8e905b81152~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_1060,h_336,al_c,lg_1,q_85/bf9d03_349861fbe91746fa8c07a8e905b81152~mv2.png" draggable="false"/></wow-image></div><button class="Auo0a" type="button" data-hook="image-expand-button" aria-label="Expand image"><svg viewBox="0 0 19 19" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="_8kM3N"><path d="M15.071 8.371V4.585l-4.355 4.356a.2.2 0 0 1-.283 0l-.374-.374a.2.2 0 0 1 0-.283l4.356-4.355h-3.786a.2.2 0 0 1-.2-.2V3.2c0-.11.09-.2.2-.2H16v5.371a.2.2 0 0 1-.2.2h-.529a.2.2 0 0 1-.2-.2zm-6.5 6.9v.529a.2.2 0 0 1-.2.2H3v-5.371c0-.11.09-.2.2-.2h.529c.11 0 .2.09.2.2v3.786l4.355-4.356a.2.2 0 0 1 .283 0l.374.374a.2.2 0 0 1 0 .283L4.585 15.07h3.786c.11 0 .2.09.2.2z" fill="#000" fill-rule="nonzero"></path></svg></button></div></figure></div></div></div><div type="image" data-hook="rcv-block5"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK WmTdT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-11loh"><span class="_1Kc57"><em style="font-style:italic"><span>Oversimplification of the LDAP authentication process to illustrate the communication flow as well as an attacker’s desire to intercept by positioning themselves between the application and Active Directory.</span></em></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block6"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1" dir="auto" id="viewer-ae6r2"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block7"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-1lt0l"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Knowing that these types of communication occur over LDAP, its fairly easy to see why it needs to be as secure as possible (what attacker wouldn’t want a valid authentication ticket).</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block8"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1" dir="auto" id="viewer-6041e"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block9"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:2" dir="auto" id="viewer-ab4"><span class="_1Kc57"><strong style="font-weight:700"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>LDAP Channel Binding</span></u></strong></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block10"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-80ak1"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>LDAP channel binding was brought to our attention by </span><a target="_blank" href="https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4034879/how-to-add-the-ldapenforcechannelbinding-registry-entry" rel="noopener" class="XSxHY gMMfB" data-hook="web-link"><span>Microsoft</span></a><span> with the tagline “To make LDAP authentication over SSL/TLS more secure”. Basically, LDAP channel binding is the act of tying the TLS tunnel and the application layer (leveraged by LDAP) together to create a unique identifier (channel binding token) for that specific LDAP session. This channel binding token (CBT) can only be used within that TLS tunnel and therefore prevents a “stolen” LDAP ticket from being leveraged elsewhere. </span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block11"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1" dir="auto" id="viewer-25tsn"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block12"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:2" dir="auto" id="viewer-97jv4"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Channel binding requires a two-part implementation:</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block13"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-4maol"><span class="_1Kc57"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>Part 1:</span></u><span> Installing the necessary update on your Windows system (</span><a target="_blank" href="https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-us/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2017-8563" rel="noopener" class="XSxHY gMMfB" data-hook="web-link"><span>CVE-2017-8563</span></a><span>), which should already be in place as this was released in 2017.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block14"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1" dir="auto" id="viewer-445b"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block15"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-bfdb5"><span class="_1Kc57"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>Part 2</span></u><span>: Configuring the appropriate GPO setting on Domain Controllers (this no longer needs to be deployed via registry with the March 2020 Microsoft updates).</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block16"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ol class="fcdgz PuKmT"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-2g5l3"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Domain controller: LDAP server channel binding token requirements = “Never” </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>(default)</span></em></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-e5o7b"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Domain controller: LDAP server channel binding token requirements = “When Supported”</span></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-4k5em"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Domain controller: LDAP server channel binding token requirements = “Always”</span></span></p></li></ol></div><div type="ordered_list" data-hook="rcv-block17"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-5cobn"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>The end goal for LDAP channel binding should be c. “Always” but for auditing/testing purposes option b. “When Supported” needs to be selected to start generating failure logs with the Event ID 3039. Setting the GPO to “Always” will also permit Event ID 3039 generation but will not allow the authentication validation to occur i.e., if there are systems that do not comply, they will no longer successfully communicate with AD. See the ‘</span><a target="_blank" href="https://manage.wix.com/dashboard/5517ebab-782f-48ca-b7f0-6f6d854e0754/blog/600af0db6a779c00171ea11e/edit#_Where_to_Get" rel="noopener" class="XSxHY gMMfB" data-hook="web-link"><span>Where to Get Started</span></a><span>’ section for more information.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block18"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1" dir="auto" id="viewer-9r9rm"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block19"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:2" dir="auto" id="viewer-gopa"><span class="_1Kc57"><strong style="font-weight:700"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>LDAP Signing</span></u></strong></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block20"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-dbt2k"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>LDAP signing has been around since Server 2003 with additional auditing capabilities added in Server 2008. LDAP signing, when enforced, requires clients to sign LDAP requests with its (the client’s) digital signature. By default, Active Directory does not require LDAP communication to be signed which makes its vulnerable to hacking. When LDAP signing is enforced Domain Controllers will not allow any authentication requests without a valid signature. LDAP signing ensures that the request received by the server (Domain Controller) was sent by the client the LDAP message is purported to be from. Additionally, signing certifies that the LDAP messages are not modified or tampered with.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block21"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1" dir="auto" id="viewer-ag244"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block22"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:2" dir="auto" id="viewer-1buvo"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>LDAP signing is implemented in two-parts:</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block23"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-a770m"><span class="_1Kc57"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>Part 1</span></u><span>: Configuring Windows clients through GPO.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block24"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ol class="fcdgz PuKmT"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-ai950"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Network security: LDAP client signing requirements = “None”</span></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-792ci"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Network security: LDAP client signing requirements = “Negotiate signing” </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>(Windows 10 default)</span></em></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-adete"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Network security: LDAP client signing requirements = “Require signing”</span></span></p></li></ol></div><div type="ordered_list" data-hook="rcv-block25"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-kko3"><span class="_1Kc57"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>Part 2:</span></u><span> Configuring Domain Controllers through GPO.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block26"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ol class="fcdgz PuKmT"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-99fmp"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Domain controller: LDAP server signing requirements = “None” </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>(default)</span></em></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-riil"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Domain controller: LDAP server signing requirements = “Require signing”</span></span></p></li></ol></div><div type="ordered_list" data-hook="rcv-block27"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-dotdl"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>The end goal with LDAP signing is to “Require signing” on both Windows clients and Domain controllers. As with LDAP channel binding, a robust audit plan needs to be implemented first to ensure all systems will comply (see next section). Note that signing is only supported on Windows 7 and higher, meaning if you are running XP, do not set your Domain controllers to require signing (better yet, move off XP already).</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block28"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-4p3d9"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block29"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="iED3l T-jvd PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:2" dir="auto" id="viewer-8n85v"><span class="E07CK"><span>How Are These Vulnerabilities Being Exploited?</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block30"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-7223g"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>The major attack vectors these configurations seek to mitigate are person-in-the-middle and replay style attacks. Look no further than Microsoft&#x27;s own executive summary of </span><a target="_blank" href="https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2017-8563" rel="noopener" class="XSxHY gMMfB" data-hook="web-link"><span>CVE-2017-8563</span></a><span> which describes the exploit resolved with LDAP channel binding:</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block31"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1" dir="auto" id="viewer-fenu9"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block32"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-dt9ni"><span class="_1Kc57"><em style="font-style:italic"><span>&quot;An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Microsoft Windows when a man-in-the-middle attacker is able to successfully forward an authentication request to a Windows LDAP server, such as a system running Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) or Active Directory Lightweight Directory Services (AD LDS), which has been configured to require signing or sealing on incoming connections.</span></em></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block33"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-1uorm"><span class="_1Kc57"><em style="font-style:italic"><span>The update addresses this vulnerability by incorporating support for Extended Protection for Authentication security feature, which allows the LDAP server to detect and block such forwarded authentication requests once enabled.&quot;</span></em></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block34"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1" dir="auto" id="viewer-sq8f"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block35"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-7la0v"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>The big takeaway here is that Active Directory is vulnerable to targeted attacks against LDAP communication. As illustrated earlier an attacker would place themselves between the application performing an authentication request and Active Directory in an attempt to intercept, modify, and forward the request to obtain a valid authentication ticket. This assailant could also potentially capture a ticket that has already been validated and reuse it in the environment. Keep in mind these security exploits all occur under the guise of a normal, legitimate user which make them all the more disconcerting. </span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block36"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-ak7i0"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block37"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-bbh94"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Dirk-Jan Mollema has some excellent articles that dive into these types of attacks:</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block38"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ul class="PFjnR PuKmT"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:disc"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-3hgi2"><span class="_1Kc57"><a target="_blank" href="https://dirkjanm.io/worst-of-both-worlds-ntlm-relaying-and-kerberos-delegation/" rel="noopener" class="XSxHY gMMfB" data-hook="web-link"><span>https://dirkjanm.io/worst-of-both-worlds-ntlm-relaying-and-kerberos-delegation/</span></a></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:disc"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-as3gv"><span class="_1Kc57"><a target="_blank" href="https://dirkjanm.io/exploiting-CVE-2019-1040-relay-vulnerabilities-for-rce-and-domain-admin/" rel="noopener" class="XSxHY gMMfB" data-hook="web-link"><span>https://dirkjanm.io/exploiting-CVE-2019-1040-relay-vulnerabilities-for-rce-and-domain-admin/</span></a></span></p></li></ul></div><div type="bulleted_list" data-hook="rcv-block39"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="iED3l T-jvd PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:2" dir="auto" id="viewer-eib0v"><span class="E07CK"><span>Where to Get Started?</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block40"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-5afnr"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Anytime changes of this magnitude are recommended in an environment it can cause angst (rightly so) and misinformation. After all lots of different applications, storage devices, network equipment, and operating systems rely on Active Directory for authentication. The nice part about these recommendations is that they do not need to be implemented blindly; </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>auditing is your friend</span></strong><span>!</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block41"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1" dir="auto" id="viewer-3rcpa"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block42"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-8n98"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>With Microsoft’s March 2020 updates they have provided some great capabilities for testing/auditing LDAP channel binding (as previously mentioned, LDAP signing events have been around since Server 2008). This is great news for the admins and engineers who must answer that all important question at the next change control board meeting - “what affect will these configurations have”. Arriving at the correct resolution is straightforward:</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block43"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ol class="fcdgz PuKmT"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-341g9"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Enable LDAP events diagnostic logging to 2 or higher on all Domain Controllers using the command - </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>Reg Add HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\NTDS\Diagnostics /v &quot;16 LDAP Interface Events&quot; /t REG_DWORD /d 2</span></em></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-fio9k"><span class="_1Kc57"><span> Configure the channel binding group policy setting to “When Supported” to log binding failure events on Domain Controllers. Nothing needs to be done for LDAP signing failures as these events are already captured.</span></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-enmgq"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Configure your SIEM to alert on Directory Service Event IDs 3039 for channel binding and 2889 for signing requests that will not conform to the new requirements. These events include a Source IP address that can be used to track down the “offending” operating system/application/equipment. </span></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-4ajjs"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>With the “offenders” identified, research will need to be performed to see if they can be configured to comply.</span></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-aa4ul"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Once all systems correctly leverage channel binding and signing (no more 3039 &amp; 2889 events), enforcement should be set on the GPOs.</span></span></p><ol class="fcdgz PuKmT"><li dir="auto" aria-level="2" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:LEFT;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:lower-latin"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK YUVmI YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="" id="viewer-dr9j8"><span class="_1Kc57"><em style="font-style:italic"><span>Domain controller: LDAP server channel binding token requirements = “Always”</span></em></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="2" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:LEFT;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:lower-latin"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK YUVmI YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="" id="viewer-465lk"><span class="_1Kc57"><em style="font-style:italic"><span>Domain controller: LDAP server signing requirements = “Require signing”</span></em></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="2" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:LEFT;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:lower-latin"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK YUVmI YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="" id="viewer-9a47u"><span class="_1Kc57"><em style="font-style:italic"><span>Network security: LDAP client signing requirements = “Require signing” (Windows clients)</span></em></span></p></li></ol></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:LEFT;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK YUVmI YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-23b7s"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Show up at the change control board meeting with all the rights answers without having to break anything to get them. Stand for applause from your colleagues.</span></span></p></li></ol></div><div type="ordered_list" data-hook="rcv-block44"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="KaA6n" id="viewer-feiiv"><div class="XzRcS _0fdLB"><figure class="omglR" data-hook="figure-IMAGE"><div data-hook="image-viewer" class="IySXE"><div style="--dim-height:303;--dim-width:531;--ricos-image-default-border-color:unset" id="feiiv" class="ZYT8Y ckerf _-2uSA" data-hook="image-viewer-feiiv"><wow-image id="bf9d03_059f4ca7f8d64c86bb0f9dc1e4f3e2d1~mv2.png" class="undefined Waddv" data-image-info="{&quot;containerId&quot;:&quot;feiiv&quot;,&quot;displayMode&quot;:&quot;fill&quot;,&quot;isLQIP&quot;:true,&quot;isSEOBot&quot;:false,&quot;lqipTransition&quot;:&quot;blur&quot;,&quot;encoding&quot;:&quot;AVIF&quot;,&quot;imageData&quot;:{&quot;width&quot;:531,&quot;height&quot;:303,&quot;uri&quot;:&quot;bf9d03_059f4ca7f8d64c86bb0f9dc1e4f3e2d1~mv2.png&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;displayMode&quot;:&quot;fill&quot;}}" data-motion-part="BG_IMG" data-bg-effect-name="" data-has-ssr-src="true" data-animate-blur=""><img src="https://static.wixstatic.com/media/bf9d03_059f4ca7f8d64c86bb0f9dc1e4f3e2d1~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_53,h_30,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/bf9d03_059f4ca7f8d64c86bb0f9dc1e4f3e2d1~mv2.png" alt="Flow chart illustrating steps needed to implement LDAP" style="width:100%;height:100%;object-fit:cover;object-position:50% 50%;max-width:100%" data-pin-url="https://www.hub.trimarcsecurity.com/post/ldap-channel-binding-and-signing" data-pin-media="https://static.wixstatic.com/media/bf9d03_059f4ca7f8d64c86bb0f9dc1e4f3e2d1~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_637,h_364,al_c,lg_1,q_85/bf9d03_059f4ca7f8d64c86bb0f9dc1e4f3e2d1~mv2.png" draggable="false"/></wow-image></div><button class="Auo0a" type="button" data-hook="image-expand-button" aria-label="Expand image"><svg viewBox="0 0 19 19" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="_8kM3N"><path d="M15.071 8.371V4.585l-4.355 4.356a.2.2 0 0 1-.283 0l-.374-.374a.2.2 0 0 1 0-.283l4.356-4.355h-3.786a.2.2 0 0 1-.2-.2V3.2c0-.11.09-.2.2-.2H16v5.371a.2.2 0 0 1-.2.2h-.529a.2.2 0 0 1-.2-.2zm-6.5 6.9v.529a.2.2 0 0 1-.2.2H3v-5.371c0-.11.09-.2.2-.2h.529c.11 0 .2.09.2.2v3.786l4.355-4.356a.2.2 0 0 1 .283 0l.374.374a.2.2 0 0 1 0 .283L4.585 15.07h3.786c.11 0 .2.09.2.2z" fill="#000" fill-rule="nonzero"></path></svg></button></div></figure></div></div></div><div type="image" data-hook="rcv-block45"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-1q4mk"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>It is important to note that Windows systems and Microsoft applications will not have any issues with these settings as long as the necessary updates have been applied and the Group Policy settings are configured correctly. LDAP channel binding is rare outside of the Windows family but audit to be sure. LDAP signing, on the other hand, is common and therefore should be audited. Simply put, audit your environment. This will also allow you to see if changes made to the “offending” systems are in fact working before implementing the Group Policy settings that will require these configurations.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block46"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-fusne"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block47"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="iED3l T-jvd PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:2" dir="auto" id="viewer-67j49"><span class="E07CK"><span>Why Should We Deploy These Settings?</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block48"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-d65i4"><span class="_1Kc57"><span>Hopefully at this point in the article the Why Should We Deploy These Settings question has been thoroughly answered. LDAP is inherently susceptible to attacks and having these settings configured to Microsoft’s </span><a target="_blank" href="https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4520412/2020-ldap-channel-binding-and-ldap-signing-requirements-for-windows" rel="noopener" class="XSxHY gMMfB" data-hook="web-link"><span>recommendation</span></a><span> is one (or two in this case) ways to better harden your Active Directory environment. Just because Microsoft has decided not to force these changes on customers (for now) does not mean LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing should be ignored. If done correctly, and with proper forethought, these settings are an easy win for the security of any AD forest. </span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block49"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" style="padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0;line-height:1.5" dir="auto" id="viewer-i729"><span class="_1Kc57"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block50"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-4qh8e"><span class="_1Kc57"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>References &amp; Additional Information</span></u></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block51"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ul class="PFjnR PuKmT"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="_0x2oV" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:disc"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="" id="viewer-7saip"><span class="_1Kc57"><a target="_blank" href="https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-us/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2017-8563" rel="noopener" class="XSxHY gMMfB" data-breakout="normal"><div class="KaA6n" id="viewer-5c4v0"><div class="XzRcS _0fdLB QFrlT"><div class="MxHee" data-hook="divider divider-single" role="separator" aria-orientation="horizontal"><div fill-rule="nonzero"></path></svg></button></div></figure></div></div></div><div type="image" data-hook="rcv-block54"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-c0qrq"><span class="_1Kc57"><em style="font-style:italic"><span>By: Scott W Blake </span></em></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block55"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="EY0Xg W2aKK PuKmT YjabP" dir="auto" id="viewer-2s8b4"><span class="_1Kc57"><em style="font-style:italic"><span>Trimarc Security Consultant with 10+ years building, class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">HOW WE HELP</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixGuard wixui-rich-text__text">​</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="line-height:1.3em; font-size:15px;"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><a href="https://www.trimarcsecurity.com/ad-security-assessment" target="_self" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif; font-size:15px; letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Active </span><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif; font-size:15px; letter-spacing:0.0375em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Directory</span><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif; font-size:15px; letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">&nbsp;Security</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixGuard wixui-rich-text__text">​</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><a href="https://www.trimarcsecurity.com/microsoftcloud-security-assessment" target="_self" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Microsoft Cloud (Azure AD &amp; Microsoft Office 365)</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixGuard wixui-rich-text__text">​</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:bold;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixGuard wixui-rich-text__text">​</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><a href="https://www.trimarcsecurity.com/research" target="_self" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Research</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixGuard wixui-rich-text__text">​</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><a href="https://www.trimarcsecurity.com/webcasts" target="_self" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Webcasts</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixGuard wixui-rich-text__text">​</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><a href="https://www.hub.trimarcsecurity.com/presentations" target="_self" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Presentations</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixGuard wixui-rich-text__text">​</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:15px; line-height:1.3em;"><a href="https://www.hub.trimarcsecurity.com/posts" target="_self" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:12px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:arial;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(97, 96, 96);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:15px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:jura,sans-serif;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="color_11 wixui-rich-text__text" style="color:#FFFFFF;"><span style="letter-spacing:0.03em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Posts</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></p>
